battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Super Smash Sweeper
sets.description:
• Shell Smash and Skill Link more than make up for Cloyster's weak Attack stat, making it a formidable sweeper that Focus Sash and Mimikyu can't easily stop.

  • Ice Shard may seem like overkill, but it helps for not only picking off weakened threats, but getting around priority attacks from Breloom, Dragapult, and Meowscarada.

  • Rock Blast is Closyer's best shot at dealing with the many Tera Fires that will attempt to deal with Icicle Spear, as well as OHKOing Volcarona.

Tera Types

  • Ice-type: The increased damage from Tera Ice makes it very difficult for Pokemon to wall Cloyster without resisting it, with even Corviknight getting OHKOed by +2 Adamant Icicle Spear after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Fire-type: While boosted Tera Blast actually does less damage to Corviknight than Tera Ice Icicle Spear, Tera Fire otherwise helps Cloyster muscle past Steel-types it traditionally struggles to beat, such as Scizor.

  • Ghost-type: Since Cloyster will often be at extremely low health after Shell Smash, Tera Ghost helps it avoid getting revenge killed by Breloom's Mach Punch. It also provides coverage against Gholdengo with Tera Blast.

  • Normal-type: Tera Normal offers no offensive benefits to Cloyster, but it does prevent Mimikyu from revenge killing it with Shadow Sneak.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Considering Cloyster's paper thin Special Defense, Focus Sash gives Cloyster by far the most set up opportunities.

  • King's Rock: King's Rock is a risky option for making Cloyster difficult to set up, but it does give Icicle Spear a 41% chance of flinching.

sets.name: Imposter
sets.description: With Imposter, Chansey transforms into a far bulkier version of the opposing Pokemon, which can be further bolstered by Eviolite. This provides a myriad of benefits, including blanket checking most Pokemon, scouting sets, and PP stalling less threatening foes. While Eviolite is usually the best item, Toxic Orb provides much better matchups against Poison Heal users while Covert Cloak is useful against Nuzzle and Spirit Shackle users. The given moves offer the most utility in the rare situations Chansey is not transformed, like phazing Substitute users, pivoting, acting as a cleric, and removing Chansey's Toxic Orb. Offensive threats such as Zacian-C and Poison Heal users such as Arceus-Fairy appreciate the information Imposter Chansey provides through scouting, with Poison Heal users also acting as Knock Off absorbers. Imposter Chansey appreciates slow pivoting from Pokemon like Dondozo and RegenVest Ting-Lu for safe scouting; these Pokemon can also provide Knock Off support, aiding against Judgment users like Miraidon that can otherwise defeat Imposter Chansey. Tera Normal gives Chansey a STAB boost on Judgment, improving its matchup into Pokemon like Miraidon, while Tera Fire and Tera Ghost are useful against Zacian-C and trapping moves, respectively.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Extreme Killernite
sets.description:
• With Tera Normal, Dragonite can do its best impression of Arceus, with a powerful Extreme Speed that makes Dragonite a great revenge killer and sweeper in one!

  • Earthquake is Dragonite's strongest tool against most Steel-types, but Fire Punch is worth considering to hit Corviknight.

  • While a Dragon-type STAB move is useful against opposing Dragons and is Dragonite's best shot at picking off weakened Dondozo, it's not strictly needed on this Dragonite.

  • A Jolly nature allows Dragonite to outspeed Dragapult after one use of Dragon Dance, but Adamant is a reasonable consideration if revenge killing with Extreme Speed is more important.

Items

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry gives Dragonite more set up opportunities against status moves and pairs particularly well with Outrage to cure confusion.

  • Silk Scarf: This item goes all in on Extreme Speed's revenge killing power, without conflicting with Multiscale.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb doesn't pair well with Multiscale on paper, but the power boost it gives Extreme Speed can let Dragonite clean teams up earlier.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description:
• Dragonite uses both Multiscale and the unpredictability of Terastallization to become an extremely dangerous sweeper!

Tera Types

  • Steel-type: Dragonite has superb synergy with Tera Steel, resisting most of its weaknesses, and particularly helping against Fairy-types and opposing Dragon-types. When paired with Safety Goggles, this Dragonite can take advantage of Amoonguss effectively as well.

  • Fire-type: With Tera Fire, Dragonite deals massive damage to Corviknight with +1 Fire Punch, in addition to gaining a useful Fairy-type resistance.

Items

  • Lum Berry: With a Lum Berry, Dragonite can set up against status moves and use Outrage with less risk late game.

  • Safety Goggles: Safety Goggles blocks Spore from Breloom and Amoonguss, though it is less versatile than Lum Berry.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb doesn't fit well with Multiscale, but it's notable for allowing Tera Fire Dragonite a 75% chance to OHKO Corviknight after Dragon Dance.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Choice Band makes Dragonite both an effective late-game cleaner with Tera Normal Extreme Speed and effective at breaking through many defensive Pokemon.

  • Outrage is strong enough to potentially 2HKO Impish Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage, though it leaves Dragonite very vulnerable to getting revenge killed.

sets.name: Focus Sash Spore
sets.description:
• Since it can sleep foes without restriction, Breloom is a monstrous Focus Sash foe that every team needs to prepare for!

  • Bulldoze is Breloom's best option against Gholdengo and provides valuable speed control.

  • Close Combat lets Breloom muscle past bulkier threats more easily, such as Tera Steel Garganacl.

  • Rock Tomb provides speed control and ensures that Breloom is not walled by Flying-types such as Dragonite.

Tera Types

  • Fighting-type: Breloom doesn't Terastallize often, but Fighting Tera is a good choice for picking off foes more easily with Mach Punch.

  • Ground-type: Tera Ground-boosted Bulldoze has a 93.8% chance to OHKO 4 HP Gholdengo, making Breloom a situational lure. It also severely punishes Rotom-W that attempt to Volt Switch out, and Hippowdon that don't Terastallize.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description:
• Salamence is somewhat overshadowed by other Dragon-types, but it has a trick up its claws: with a Flying Tera type, a boosted Dual Wingbeat has a 75% chance to OHKO offensive Mimikyu through its disguise! It also comes in handy for OHKOing Breloom through its Focus Sash.

  • Earthquake is the best option for hitting Steel-types such as Gholdengo hard, but Fire Blast is Salamence's best shot at 2HKOing Corviknight.

Abilities

  • Intimidate: While Salamence isn't particularly bulky, Intimidate makes setting up far easier when paired with a Flying Tera type that removes Salamence's common weaknesses.

  • Moxie: With Moxie, Salamence has the potential to seriously punish Breloom leads or snowball through teams even without Dragon Dance.

sets.name: Mixed Attacker
sets.description:
• Salamence can have trouble standing apart from all the dangerous Dragon-types, but its great mixed offenses and Moxie give it a niche.

  • Dual Wingbeat lets Salamence OHKO Breloom regardless of its Focus Sash, something very few Pokemon can do.

  • Earthquake is the more reliable option for Steel-types, but Fire Blast does get a 2HKO on Corviknight.

  • Draco Meteor deals massive damage to Dondozo, usually doing more than 50% to physically defensive ones.

Tera Types

  • Steel-type: A Steel Tera type covers a lot of Salamence's weaknesses and makes dealing with Mimikyu much easier.

  • Fire-type: With a Fire Tera type, not only does Salamence gain a resistance to Fairy-type attacks, but it also has an 87.5% chance of OHKOing Corviknight when Fire Blast hits.

  • Dragon-type: While this Tera type fails to help Salamence much defensively, it makes Draco Meteor 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo.

sets.name: Swords Dance Sweeper
sets.description:
• The classic Swords Dance sweeper is still a big threat, thanks to its good bulk, unique Speed tier, and excellent use of Terastallization.

  • Outrage is by far Garchomp's strongest STAB move, but the lock-in effect makes it very vulnerable to Fairy-types such as Mimikyu.

  • Despite its low base power, Fire Fang is Garchomp's best shot at breaking past Corviknight after a Swords Dance. If Garchomp is almost always Terastallized on your team, Tera Blast can be used instead.

Tera Types

  • Steel-type: A Steel Tera type has excellent synergy with Garchomp's typing, letting it more effectively tackle faster Dragon-types, Mimikyu, and Ice Shard from the likes of Baxcalibur and Cloyster.

  • Fire-type: While the Stealth Rock weakness is unfortunate against bulkier teams, a Fire Tera type lets Life Orb Garchomp OHKO Corviknight with a +2 Fire Fang 93.8% of the time.

  • Ground-type: While the defensive synergy with Garchomp's former typing isn't that strong, a Ground Tera type lets Garchomp become more of a hit-and-run attacker with Earthquake, dealing good damage to Dondozo before being forced out by Yawn.

sets.name: Entry Hazard Setter
sets.description: A spread of 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD should be used with Ice Scales to be a specially defensive wall.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Support
sets.description:
• Few Pokemon are more reliable at setting up Stealth Rock and phazing than Hippowdon.

  • Roar is a more direct phazing option than Yawn, and it is helpful against dangerous setup sweepers that may run Lum Berry, such as Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Slack Off may seem like an obvious choice to make a defensive Pokemon last longer, but Hippowdon is often more focused on support than walling, so Slack Off doesn't fit every team.

  • Rock Tomb not only provides helpful speed control, but also pops Air Balloon on foes Hippowdon would otherwise struggle with, such as Gholdengo.

Tera Types

  • Grass-type: Hippowdon doesn't Terastallize often, but a Grass Tera type does help it against Breloom and Water-types such as Rotom-W.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:

sets.name: Choice Attacker
sets.description:
• Rotom-H sets itself apart from other Fire-types, with its Ground immunity and Volt Switch pivoting.

  • Trick gives Rotom-H an excellent tool against defensive foes, such as Dondozo and Skeledirge.

  • Make sure to get a Rotom-H with a neutral nature and then use a Timid Mint on it. This way, it can't be confused by any Berries given with Trick.

Tera Types

  • Electric-type: Electric is an easy Tera type to recommend, as it increases damage output and removes all of Rotom-H's weaknesses.

  • Fairy-type: A Fairy Tera typing with Tera Blast makes Rotom-H much better equipped to handle normally problematic Dragon-types, such as Garchomp and Dragapult.

  • Fire-type: When paired with Tera Blast, Rotom-H now has a much more reliable Fire-type STAB move than Overheat, at the cost of retaining several problematic weaknesses.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• With good bulk, a solid defensive typing, and access to Spore, Clear Smog, and Regenerator, Amoonguss is a fantastic support and disruptor option.

  • Clear Smog prevents Amoonguss from getting set up on unless the opponent is Steel-type or has a Substitute up.

  • Hex both punishes foes put to sleep by Spore and hits Air Balloon Gholdengo.

  • Stomping Tantrum gets around Assault Vest Gholdengo.

Items

  • Black Sludge: Black Sludge gives Amoonguss longevity outside of Synthesis and Regenerator; however, if Amoonguss Terastallizes into a type that isn't Poison, it will take damage instead.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is an alternative form of recovery, and it can be used regardless of Amoonguss's Tera type.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves with residual damage, potentially breaking Focus Sash in the process.

Tera Types

  • Dark-type: While Amoonguss doesn't Terastallize often, Dark removes its weakness to Psychic-type attacks and makes Foul Play stronger, at the cost of gaining new weaknesses.

  • Poison-type: Poison removes Grass-type weaknesses, but makes Amoonguss weak to Ground-type attacks.

  • Steel-type: While it makes Amoonguss weak to Ground- and Fighting-type attacks, it also grants Amoonguss with a plethora of resistances, and it can be a tough Pokemon to break once foes like Breloom are KOed.

sets.name: HARBINGER
sets.description:
• With its high power and great STAB combination, Hydreigon makes for a formidable attacker.

  • Tera Blast can be used in tandem with an Electric Tera type to deal heavy damage to Dondozo.

  • Flamethrower is useful for hitting Steel-types such as Scizor and otherwise decent Dark Pulse switch-ins like Meowscarada.

  • Flash Cannon is Hydreigon’s best option to hit Fairy-types such as Mimikyu.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf patches up Hydreigon’s somewhat lackluster Speed, allowing it to threaten a wider portion of the metagame with its high-powered attacks.

  • Choice Specs: If your team has another Scarf user, Choice Specs Hydreigon is a nuclear wallbreaker that can pummel unsuspecting teams.

Tera Types

  • Electric-type: Thanks to Levitate and a Tera type of Electric, Hydreigon lacks any sort of weaknesses, and gains a powerful Tera Blast to hit Dondozo with, being able to break past it without fearing Fissure.

  • Dark-type: Tera-boosted Dark Pulse is an absurdly powerful weapon, and when coupled with its flinch rate, Tera Dark Hydreigon can potentially muscle its way out of otherwise hopeless situations.

  • Steel-type: A Steel Tera type can be used to get around the many Dragon and Fairy-types that try to revenge kill Hydreigon, though it is still vulnerable to Mach Punch from Breloom.

  • Fire-type: Terastallizing into the fire typing will grant Hydreigon a resistance to Fairy-types while removing its weakness to Fighting-types and giving it a good move to hit Steel-types with. However, unlike Tera Steel it does not grant a resistance to Dragon, and it also gives Hydreigon a few new weaknesses.

sets.name: Quiver Dance Sweeper
sets.description:
• With Flame Body, several physical attackers like Annihilape, Meowscarada, and Mimikyu can be crippled on contact, which helps a lot.

  • Quiver Dance lets Volcarona sweep, alongside the possibility of Fiery Dance further boosting Special Attack. Fire Blast can be used if greater damage output is wanted.

  • Giga Drain is the best coverage option for Volcarona, as it helps it deal with Water-type Pokémon, as well as recover a good amount of HP.

  • Water-type Tera Blast helps Volcarona deal with Pokemon like Skeledirge, Ceruledge, and other Volcarona. Volcarona with Bug Buzz can also be used, as it is a very powerful STAB move and helps Volcarona deal with Hydreigon.

Tera Types

  • Water-type: Terastallizing into the Water typing nullifies Volcarona's most common weakness in Rock-type. Tera Blast damages Hydreigon decently prior to Terastallizing. Water-type Tera Blast is also the best option Volcarona has to hit Skeledirge.

  • Grass-type: The Grass typing strengthens Giga Drain and nullifies Volcarona's weakness to Water-types, most notably helping against Dondozo and Rotom-W.

  • Fire-type: Terastallizing into Fire typing makes Volcarona's Fire Blast even more powerful.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: It is the best option on Volcarona, as it circumvents its crippling Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry helps Volcarona accrue boosts more easily with Quiver Dance and lets it avoid being 2HKOed by Mimikyu and Dragonite.

  • Life Orb: This is the most reliable tool for helping Volcarona sweep in the late-game.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: An EV spread of 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD should be used on Fur Coat variants.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description:
• Thanks to Disguise, Mimikyu is a premier revenge killer and sweeper in Battle Stadium Singles!

  • Tera Blast is a risky option due to making your team commit to Terastallizing Mimikyu, but it can be worth it for muscling through Mimikyu's usual checks, such as Corviknight and Tera Steel Pokemon.

Tera Types

  • Ghost-type: The extra damage on Shadow Sneak gives Mimikyu an easier time sweeping late-game.

  • Fire-type: With Tera Blast, Jolly Mimikyu has a 75% chance to OHKO Corviknight after Swords Dance, which means most other Steel-types will have a far more difficult time dealing with Mimikyu.

  • Electric-type: While not as effective against Steel-types as Tera Fire, it still deals massive damage to Corviknight, comma and gives Mimikyu better chip damage to Dondozo.

  • Normal-type: Tera Normal doesn't help Mimikyu offensively and makes Mimikyu vulnerable to Mach Punch and Dragon Darts, making it a niche option. However, it does severely punish Dragapult if it uses Phantom Force.

sets.name: Curse Stall
sets.description:
• The combination of Curse, Substitute, and Pain Split is devastating against key defensive Pokemon such as Garganacl and Dondozo.

  • Shadow Claw is Mimikyu's best shot at dealing damage to Gholdengo, at the cost of doing poorly against Normal-types.

  • Play Rough is Mimikyu's strongest STAB move, though it will make Mimikyu nearly helpless against Gholdengo.

  • Taunt does an even better job of shutting down defensive foes, but makes Mimikyu totally useless against Gholdengo.

Tera Types

  • Ghost-type or Fairy-type: Terastallizing this Mimikyu for extra damage output is fairly situational, but getting a bit of extra power can help late game.

  • Flying-type: Against common users of Fissure such as Dondozo, this gives Mimikyu a situational way to stall them out more easily while healthy.

sets.name: Trick Scarf
sets.description:
• Mimikyu might seem like an odd user of Choice Scarf with its low offenses, but with Trick and Disguise, it becomes a very disruptive Pokemon against defensive foes like Dondozo and Corviknight.

  • Shadow Sneak is a reasonable option to give Mimikyu priority after using Trick.

  • Wood Hammer hits Water-types such as Rotom-W very hard.

  • Thunder Wave or Will-O-Wisp let Mimikyu further disrupt Pokemon after using Trick, or can be used as an emergency way to stop a sweeper while still holding Choice Scarf.

  • Mimikyu should have a neutral nature with a Jolly Mint used on it. This way, Mimikyu can't be confused by eating any Berry after using Trick.

Tera Types

  • Ghost-type: Tera Ghost gives Mimikyu a good chance to OHKO Dragapult with Shadow Claw.

  • Grass-type: With Wood Hammer being boosted, Mimikyu OHKOes offensive Rotom-W.

  • Normal-type: While this makes Mimikyu far more vulnerable to Breloom, it is useful for catching other Ghost-types off guard.

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This analysis is currently undergoing copyediting. If you would like to see the analysis in its current state, check it out here.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: Ice Scales Corviknight is a premier specially defensive pivot that can check prominent special attackers like Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Dragapult with its immense bulk and great typing while also providing entry hazard removal. Brave Bird is Corviknight's most consistent attack and 2HKOes or 3HKOes most special attackers, whereas Iron Head OHKOes Flutter Mane and avoids recoil. Defog provides entry hazard control, which is very crucial for teams facing hazard-stacking threats like Ting-Lu and Garchomp, while U-turn provides slow pivoting support for offensive teammates. As a result, frail pokemon such as Dragapult, Iron Bundle, and Iron Moth are great teammates, as they appreciate Corviknight's ability to get them in safely. Ice Scales Corviknight struggles against strong physical attackers, so pairing it with a strong physical wall like Avalugg or Hippowdon is recommended. Even with Ice Scales, Corviknight can be susceptible to strong special attacking Fire-types like Chi-Yu and Iron Moth, so Regenerator Garchomp and Ting-Lu make good teammates. Corviknight is prone to having its Defog blocked by Good as Gold, so it's strongly recommended for it to be paired with spinners such as Great Tusk that can remove entry hazards if Corviknight is unable to.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description: Making use of Fur Coat to bolster its high Defense and good defensive typing, Corviknight serves as a strong physical wall that can switch into threatening attackers like non-Mold Breaker Great Tusk and Kingambit, and is a Defogger that isn't threatened by common entry hazard setters like Garchomp and Clodsire. U-turn and minimum Speed allow Corviknight to act as a slow pivot, safely bringing in offensive teammates like Volcarona and Dragonite. Corviknight's average Special Defense means that it has a hard time against special attackers, so it benefits from specially defensive teammates like Florges and Blissey. Corviknight also struggles to meaningfully damage Rock- and Steel-type foes like Garganacl and Iron Treads, so teammates like Iron Bundle and Chi-Yu that can handle these Pokemon are appreciated.

sets.name: Dual Screens
sets.description:
• With Prankster and the movepool to use it, Grimmsnarl is one of the best dual screens setters, as it is useful for setting up dangerous sweepers such as Dragonite.

  • Parting Shot is not only useful for dropping stats, but the pivoting action can let Grimmsnarl come in later to set up screens if it's in a bad matchup.

  • Thunder Wave is a reasonable alternative for crippling fast foes that may be problematic for sweeps.

  • Spirit Break hits Dragon-types, making it a good offensive move.

  • Alternatively, Foul Play is notable for breaking Gholdengo's Substitute and punishing physical setup sweepers.

Tera Types

  • Grass-type: Grimmsnarl should almost never Terastallize, since it's trying to support sweepers rather than deal serious damage on its own. Still, a Grass Tera type is a reasonable choice for blocking Spore from Breloom and Amoonguss.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Physical Attacker
sets.description:
• Dragapult's incredible Speed makes it a very effective hit-and-run attacker.

  • Phantom Force is risky due to the two turns making Dragapult vulnerable to Normal-types and surprise Terastallization, but lack of many strong Ghost-resistant foes makes it an effective late-game cleaning move.

Tera Types

  • Dragon-type and Ghost-type: Terastallizing into either of Dragapult's STAB types makes it even more difficult to wall, with Ghost being notable for letting Dragapult use a less risky STAB move in Tera Blast.

  • Fire-type: Tera Fire gives a valuable Fairy-type resistance and is a more powerful tool against Steel-types at the cost of a Stealth Rock weakness.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band guarantees that Breloom is OHKOed through its Focus Sash with Dragon Darts.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb makes Sucker Punch a less risky option.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description:
• Despite Dragapult's insane Speed stat, Dragon Dance insulates it from popular Choice Scarf revenge killers such as Gholdengo, making it a great sweeper.

  • Phantom Force's drawback can be an issue when Normal-types are potentially around, but its great coverage still makes it good way to clean teams.

Tera Types

  • Dragon-type: Not only does this make Dragon Darts difficult to wall, but it clinches a OHKO on Breloom regardless of the item.

  • Steel-type: Steel covers a lot of Dragapult's former weaknesses, letting it set up on new foes such as Mimikyu.

  • Fire-type: Not only does this make Fairy-types easier to deal with, but it can help Dragapult sweep through defensive Steel-types such as Corviknight with Tera Blast.

  • Ghost-type: Terastallizing into a Ghost-type gives Dragapult the option for a much more reliable STAB move in Tera Blast, at the cost of not helping it set up against new threats.

sets.name: Special Attacker
sets.description:
• Draco Meteor and Shadow Ball give Dragapult high-powered and reliable STAB attacks, respectively.

  • Thunderbolt is the recommended coverage move for hitting Corviknight and Dondozo hard.

  • Even though it's weak, U-turn is a reasonable consideration for pivoting and breaking Mimikyu's Disguise.

Tera Types

  • Ghost-type: The stronger Shadow Ball makes this Dragapult difficult to wall outside of Normal-types and Ghost resistant foes such as Garganacl.

  • Fire-type: The Fairy-type resistance and powerful Flamethrower can make the Stealth Rock weakness worth it.

  • Electric-type: Tera Electric Dragapult still deals plenty of damage to Corviknight, while being less vulnerable to Dondozo's Water-type attacks compared to a Fire Tera type.

sets.name: Hadron Engine
sets.description: Choice Specs Hadron Engine Dragapult is a premier wallbreaker and pivot that takes advantage of Electric Terrain to overwhelm common Ice Scales users. Shadow Ball and Draco Meteor provide it with consistent and powerful STAB attacks, respectively. Thunderbolt is a strong coverage move that is also boosted by Electric Terrain, denting RegenVest Kingambit and giving Dragapult a chance to 2HKO Ice Scales Corviknight and Toxapex after Stealth Rock. Strong physical attackers like Great Tusk and Iron Valiant pair well with Dragapult, which brings them in with U-turn on Pokemon they can threaten out, such as Blissey and Iron Treads. In return, Dragapult breaks through Fur Coat users like Hippodown and Corviknight for them. Dragapult is forced out by priority users such as Aerilate Dragonite and Triage Flutter Mane, so Pokemon that can switch into them like Gholdengo and Clodsire are recommended. Dragapult pairs well with defensive pivots like Corviknight and Iron Hands that can safely bring it onto the field to outspeed and threaten a majority of offensive threats, such as Flutter Mane and Chein-Pao. Entry hazards setters like Ting-Lu and Palossand can set Spikes and Stealth Rock, respectively, which helps Dragapult break past switch-ins like Kingambit more easily.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: CRITTY CAT
sets.description:
• With its good Attack, Speed, and access to Flower Trick and Knock Off, Meowscarada is a potent cleaner cleaner that is also hard to switch into.

  • With its guaranteed critical hit, Flower Trick is a dangerous cleaning move once resistances to it have been sufficiently chipped.

  • Trick can help Choice-locked sets incapacitate an annoying wall, such as Dondozo or Amoonguss, by locking them into a single move. Make sure to use a neutral nature and use a Jolly Mint on Meowscarada, so it won't get confused by eating any Berry after Trick.

Abilities

  • Protean: Protean’s type-shifting allows Meowscarada to make the most of its colorful movepool, particularly on Choice-locked sets, where the limitation to only changing types once is effectively nullified.

  • Overgrow: If you intend to make use of a Tera type other than Grass or switch moves often, Overgrow is worth considering, as it allows Meowscarada more flexibility with its moves by not changing type and removing STAB from Flower Trick or Knock Off.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band boosted Meowscarada hits incredibly hard, and with its naturally high Speed it can serve as a cleaner and a potential wallbreaker.

  • Choice Scarf: With the Speed offered via Choice Scarf, Meowscarada can threaten otherwise faster foes, such as Dragapult, potentially putting more pressure on offensive teams.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash allows Meowscarada to bypass its rather lackluster bulk, allowing it to take a hit and potentially grab two KOs when it might’ve otherwise only gotten one.

Tera Types

  • Grass-type: While Terastallizing does override Protean, Tera Grass Meowscarada can be used to power through teams ill-prepared for it. Dual Screens teams in particular are especially vulnerable to the sheer power of Choice Band-boosted Tera Grass Flower Trick.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Defensive Gator
sets.description:
• Thanks to Will-O-Wisp, instant recovery, and Unaware, Skeledirge distinguishes itself as one of the premier physical walls.

  • Torch Song is a powerful STAB move that allows Skeledirge to become a potential win condition.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Terastallizing into the Fairy typing removes Skeledirges glaring weakness to Dark and provides an overall superior defensive typing. It also provides a neutral typing for the inevitable Shadow Balls that will be thrown at Skeledirge. With proper timing, Skeledirge can defeat counters meant to deal with it, most notably Gholdengo and Dragapult.

  • Water-type: A Water Tera type lets Skeledirge take on formerly super effective attacks such as Liquidation, providing a valuable turn to burn the offender. It should be noted that Tera Water tends to be a safer option versus the ubiquitous Gholdengo, as it does not often run Thunderbolt.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 244 Def / 12 Spe with Bold: The EVs are set to maximize physical bulk with just enough Speed to outpace uninvested Corviknight.

  • 220 HP / 164 Defense / 4 SpA / 108 Spd / 12 Spe with Calm: This EV spread allows both Tera Fairy and Water Skeledirge to avoid a 2HKO from a plethora of offensive threats, such as Modest Gholdengo, Adamant Azumarill, and Choice Specs Dragapult, while still boasting significant physical bulk. With this spread, alternative move slot choices such as Encore and Substitute become viable and allow Skeledirge to wreak havoc on slower defensive and balance teams.

Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
• With Purifying Salt making it immune to status and Salt Cure providing useful chip damage, especially against Water- and Steel-types, Garganacl is a dangerous defensive setup Pokemon.

  • Body Press is the best option for consistency against offensive teams.

  • Fissure severely punishes passive play against Garganacl, at the cost of forcing it to rely on Salt Cure residual damage against offensive teams.

Tera Types

  • Flying-type: A Flying typing lets Garganacl take on formerly super effective attacks such as Earthquake and Close Combat while making it a reasonable check to most Breloom.

  • Steel-type: Terastallizing into a Steel-type stops Amoonguss from clearing its boosts with Clear Smog and makes Garganacl a decent check to Fairy-types such as offensive Mimikyu and Substitute + Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

  • Ghost-type: A Ghost Tera type gives Garganacl an immunity to Body Press, giving it the edge against Corviknight and opposing Garganacl, especially when paired with Leftovers.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: If using Tera Flying Garganacl, maximizing Special Defense is the best choice for easier setup.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: In addition to powering up Body Press, a focus on Defense makes setting up on powerful setup sweepers such as Dragonite an easier task.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 SpD with Careful: This EV spread allows Tera Steel Garganacl to avoid a 2HKO from Breloom's Mach Punch after Iron Defense.

sets.name: Shed Tail
sets.description: On Choice Scarf, 20 EVs can be taken out of HP and put into Special Attack for a 100% chance to OHKO Dragapult.

Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Debris Lead
sets.description:
• With a solid early-game Speed tier, utility, high Special Attack, and decent coverage options, Glimmora can set the tone of a battle, sometimes scoring KOs before fulfilling its main role of setting entry hazards.

  • Mud Shot will fail to KO many foes—most notably other Glimmora—but it is a valuable form of speed control that can immediately turn the game in your favor.

  • Memento is a key piece of Glimmora's potential utility, as it immediately makes way for a devastating sweeper to set up against foes with halved offensive stats and potentially lowered Speed.

Tera Types

  • Grass-type: A Grass Tera type is an option to absorb Spore from Breloom, but given the set's purpose, this is generally not recommended.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: OHKO Fisher
sets.description:
• With immense bulk, Yawn, and Unaware, Dondozo is not only an impressive defensive Pokemon, but one of the most dangerous OHKO fishers in the game.

  • Protect is not only useful for scouting for unexpected Tera types, but pairs well with Yawn and Leftovers to give Dondozo more longevity.

Tera Types

  • Grass-type: A Grass Tera type is useful enough for covering Dondozo's weaknesses, and the Spore immunity makes it capable of beating Breloom too.

EV Spreads

  • 252 Def / 252 SpD / 4 Spe: With Dondozo's massive HP stat, it's still able to take physical hits fairly well with this spread, while making it feasible to Yawn against special attacking threats such as Choice Scarf Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe: This more extreme spread helps against powerful Tera users, with the ability to avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Tera Dragon Dragapult's Dragon Darts with Leftovers. This comes at the cost of being much more vulnerable to weaker special attackers.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
• With Unaware, Dondozo becomes an effective and difficult to break Curse user.

  • Even with Curse being the point of this set, Dondozo can still effectively fish for OHKOs with Fissure when it's not in a favorable set-up position.

  • Many foes will Terrastallize into a Flying-type to avoid an expected Fissure, which makes Avalanche a particularly useful coverage move.

Tera Types

  • Grass-type: With a Grass Tera Type, Dondozo can effectively set up on Breloom.

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This analysis is currently undergoing copyediting. If you would like to see the analysis in its current state, check it out here.

Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• While Clodsire is lacking in physical bulk compared to Dondozo and Skeledirge, it makes up for it in having a fantastic support movepool.

  • Yawn is very effective at forcing switches, which is especially dangerous if Stealth Rock is set up.

  • Poison Jab is Clodsire's best move against Tera Fairy Rotom-W, which is an especially important target when using Water Absorb.

  • Protect, in addition to benefiting from Leftovers, pairs well with Yawn.

  • Body Press isn't particularly strong, but it does prevent Clodsire from being totally walled by Tera Steel Hydreigon if using a physically defensive spread.

  • Black Sludge may seem appealing, but it punishes Clodsire for Terastalliizing unless it becomes Tera Poison, so Leftovers is preferred unless Leftovers is already on something else.

Tera Types

  • Flying-type: With a Flying Tera type, Clodsire no longer has to worry about Earthquake or Fissure.

  • Steel-type: A Steel Tera type allows Clodsire to take on powerful Dragon-type attacks, without the worry of Gholdengo dealing massive damage.

  • Poison-type: With Tera Poison, Clodsire not only becomes a better check to Grass- and Water-types such as Meowscarda and Rotom-W, but it can also safely run Black Sludge to punish users of Trick.

  • Fairy-type: A Fairy Tera type will stop powerful Dragon-type attacks cold without making Clodsire weak to Earthquake, but it comes at the cost of compromising its ability to check Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Unaware: If you're planning to use Clodsire to its fullest defensive potential, Unaware is the best bet against setup foes.

  • Water Absorb: Water Absorb sacrifices overall defensive potential in exchange for being able to wall Rotom-W without needing to Terastallize. If setting up Stealth Rock is important, this can be worth it.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: Maximizing Special Defense is Clodsire's best hope for handling powerful special attackers such as Choice Specs Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Clodsire's Defense may be mediocre, but with maximum investment, it can pull stunts such as usually avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Dragonite's Outrage with Leftovers.

battlestadiumsingles.overview: This analysis is currently undergoing copyediting. If you would like to see the analysis in its current state, check it out here.

sets.name: Defensive Spinner
sets.description: Rapid Spin, Knock Off, and great physical bulk make Great Tusk a fantastic utility spinner. It can check dangerous physical attackers such as Ceruledge, Slither Wing, Kingambit, and Roaring Moon and retaliate with its beefy Earthquake and Body Press. It matches up well against common entry hazard setters like Garganacl and Clodsire, and it threatens spinblockers with Knock Off; Knock Off also augments its teammates' entry hazards by removing Heavy-Duty Boots. Leftovers gives it much needed recovery—especially alongside Regenerator—but Heavy-Duty Boots prevents it from being overwhelmed by the entry hazards it must remove. Teammates such as Blissey and Slowking can cover opposing special attackers that target Great Tusk's lower Special Defense. In return, they appreciate Great Tusk dealing with physical attackers like opposing Great Tusk.

sets.name: Wallbreaker
sets.description: Choice Band Great Tusk is a dangerous wallbreaker thanks to its high-powered STAB moves and Mold Breaker to bypass Fur Coat. Knock Off has no immunities, unlike both STAB options, and removes key items like Leftovers from Corviknight. Ice Spinner breaks through defensive Dragonite and Garchomp with a clean OHKO. Fast specially offensive pivots like Iron Bundle, Dragapult, and Noivern can bring Great Tusk in safely to pressure their specially defensive switch-ins like Toxapex, Clodsire, and Blissey. Defensive pivots such as Corviknight and RegenVest Iron Hands are also good options, as they can switch into faster threats like Flutter Mane and Iron Moth, respectively, which force Great Tusk out. Dragonite and Ceruledge appreciate Great Tusk wallbreaking early-game by threatening Fur Coat users like Corviknight and Garganacl, which lets them clean up late-game more easily.

sets.name: Pixilate
sets.description: A more offensive EV spread with 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe can be used, but has a harder time setting up with Calm Mind.

sets.name: Queenly Majesty
sets.description: Queenly Majesty Flutter Mane is a fast and powerful cleaner that reliably revenge kills Dragapult, Iron Bundle, and Aerilate Dragonite. Mystical Fire hits Steel-types like Iron Treads, Thunderbolt is its strongest option against Corviknight and Toxapex, Psyshock does passable damage to Clodsire, and Hex is its strongest move if its teammates can reliably inflict status. Teammates that are susceptible to priority such as Iron Moth and Chien-Pao appreciate Flutter Mane's ability to pick off priority users and allow them to be more dangerous to opposing teams. Flutter Mane appreciates being brought in by a slow pivot like Corviknight or Chilly Reception Slowking. Flutter Mane can also struggle to break through specially defensive walls such as Ice Scales Corviknight, so pairing it with a strong physical attacker like Great Tusk or Iron Valiant is recommended.

sets.name: Regenerator Pivot
sets.description: RegenVest Iron Treads is a great specially defensive pivot and spinner. It is able to switch into prominent special attackers such as Gholdengo and Flutter Mane and threaten them out. Knock Off removes key items like Heavy-Duty Boots and deters spinblockers from switching in, and Volt Switch has excellent synergy with Regenerator. If its teammates already provide adequate entry hazard control, Iron Head and Ice Spinner are options to target Flutter Mane and Dragonite, respectively. A Sassy nature with minimum Speed investment ensures the slowest possible pivot with Volt Switch. Iron Treads appreciates physically defensive teammates like Fur Coat Slowking, which can form a VoltTurn core to bring in powerful-but-frail teammates like Iron Bundle and Dragapult.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Choice Specs Iron Bundle is a terrifying wallbreaker with incredible Speed and unresisted STAB coverage. Primordial Sea counters Desolate Land and allows Hydro Pump to OHKO most non-Ice Scales foes, while Mold Breaker breaks through walls like Ice Scales Corviknight. For the last slot, U-turn is used to pivot against Water-immune foes like Desolate Land Volcarona, while Flip Turn hits Pokemon like Ice Scales Blissey and Corviknight harder. Defensive pivots such as Corviknight help Iron Bundle safely switch into and pressure threats like Flutter Mane and Iron Moth. Strong physical attackers like Baxcalibur and Great Tusk are also good teammates, as Iron Bundle often forces in specially defensive walls that these Pokemon can threaten; Rapid Spin Great Tusk can also double as entry hazard removal. Pokemon who can set entry hazards like Ting-Lu and Garchomp are great partners for Iron Bundle, as they help it wear down its checks faster.

sets.name: Fur Coat
sets.description: Fur Coat Iron Hands uses its titanic bulk to check prominent attackers like Ceruledge and Kingambit while its solid Attack and Swords Dance prevent it from being passive. Drain Punch provides much-needed recovery as well as threatens Pokemon like Blissey and Cyclizar. Thunder Punch hits Fighting-resistant foes like Iron Moth and Flutter Mane, while Ice Punch covers Pokemon like Dragonite and Garchomp. Earthquake provides coverage for Pokemon like Clodsire that Iron Hands would otherwise struggle against. Iron Hands can also use Volt Switch alongside its low Speed to serve as a bulky slow pivot to safely bring in frail offensive teammates like Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. Because of its below average Special Defense, Iron Hands pairs well with specially defensive teammates like Blissey and Ice Scales Corviknight. Iron Hands also struggles against Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Scream Tail, so it appreciates teammates like Gholdengo and Iron Moth that can take them on.

sets.name: Desolate Land
sets.description: Iron Moth is a powerful special attacker that also provides good defensive utility thanks to Desolate Land and Morning Sun. Its near-unique offensive typing lets it threaten common walls like Ice Scales Corviknight and Scream Tail, especially when boosted by sun. U-turn can be used to maintain momentum against predicted switch-ins like Garchomp and Garganacl, while Toxic Spikes punishes switch-ins with status. Iron Moth complements Ice Scales Corviknight and Clodsire, as it covers their vulnerability to Iron Bundle. Pokemon like Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Dragonite appreciate Iron Moth taking advantage of their Steel-type checks like Corviknight.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description:
• With good bulk, an immunity to burn, and just enough Speed to work, Baxcalibur is a powerful Dragon Dance sweeper.

  • Icicle Spear KOes Breloom and Mimikyu through Focus Sash and Disguise respectively.

  • While Glaive Rush is valuable for late-game sweeping, it does make Baxcalibur very vulnerable to bulky OHKO move users such as Dondozo and Garganacl.

  • Alternatively, Ice Shard means Baxcalibur will have a difficult time breaking past bulky Steel-types early-game, but it makes it an effective cleaner otherwise.

Tera Types

  • Dragon-type: This makes Glaive Rush deal obscene damage and removes weaknesses to Mach Punch and Bullet Punch.

  • Electric-type: When paired with Tera Blast, this is Life Orb Baxcalibur's best shot at dealing damage to Dondozo switch-ins. The paralysis immunity also helps Baxcalibur set up against Chansey with less risk.

  • Steel-type: With a Tera type of Steel, Baxcalibur can set up on Mimikyu and Dragon-type attacks.

Items

  • Life Orb: This helps Baxcalibur sweep reliably and ensures Icicle Spear OHKOes Breloom through Focus Sash.

  • Loaded Dice: With a guaranteed 4 hits from Icicle Spear, Baxcalibur is able to always OHKO offensive Mimikyu after Dragon Dance.

sets.name: Bulky Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Baxcalibur's bulk and the wonderful Ice Shard make it a good user of Assault Vest, making it especially effective against the Rotom formes.

  • Icicle Spear is recommended despite its inconsistent damage, as it deals damage through Mimikyu's disguise and potentially KOes Focus Sash users like Breloom and Meowscarada.

  • Glaive Rush makes Baxcalibur very vulnerable to getting KOed the next turn, but it is still the least risky Dragon-type STAB move.

  • A Ground Tera type gives Baxcalibur a reliable STAB move in Earthquake, resistance to Stealth Rock, and removes a ton of weaknesses, all at the cost of losing to Water-types such as Rotom-W.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more discussion and resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Choice Item
sets.description:
• With Trick and an immunity to status moves, Gholdengo is a dangerous Choice item attacker for offensive and stall teams alike!

  • Thunderbolt 2HKOes Dondozo and deals serious damage to Tera Flying Garganacl.

  • Dazzling Gleam deals massive damage to Meowscarada and Hydreigon.

  • Nasty Plot can be used to give Gholdengo more bite against defensive, slower teams after using Trick.

  • Use a neutral nature Gholdengo that has a Timid Mint used on it. This way, Gholdengo can eat any Berry without being confused after Trick.

Tera Types

  • Water-type: In addition to giving Gholdengo a valuable resistance to Fire, this makes Gholdengo deal much more damage to Volcarona and common Tera Fire users such as Dragapult.

  • Ghost-type: The extra damage from Shadow Ball can make Gholdengo a more effective late-game cleaner.

  • Flying-type: With a Flying Tera type, Gholdengo gains an extremely useful immunity to Ground, which is especially useful on Choice Specs sets and against users of Fissure such as Dondozo.

  • Steel-type: Make It Rain becomes very powerful with a Tera boost, at the cost of making Gholdengo vulnerable to Mach Punch from Breloom.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With this, Gholdengo outspeeds key threats such as Dragapult, Meowscarada, and Hydreigon.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs make Gholdengo much more difficult to wall, with foes such as Dondozo getting 2HKOed.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
• Nasty Plot makes Gholdengo a terror against slower teams, especially with its good bulk, unpredictable coverage, and diverse Tera Types.

  • Substitute lets Gholdengo avoid residual damage from Garganacl's Salt Cure and ease prediction in general.

  • Psyshock lets Gholdengo break through Chansey and Clodsire more easily.

Tera Types

  • Flying-type: Flying Gholdengo gets the jump on dangerous Earthquake users such as Garchomp and Dragonite.

  • Water-type: With this Tera type, Volcarona and Skeledirge are far less likely to stop Gholdengo from sweeping.

Items

  • Leftovers: This is the most reliable option for keeping Gholdengo healthy and pairs especially well with Substitute.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak prevents Salt Cure from chipping down Gholdengo, making it far easier for it to run Recover against Garganacl.

  • Air Balloon: Air Balloon ruins Breloom's chances of winning the lead war against Gholdengo and makes Hippowdon easy setup bait.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Gholdengo's good bulk and unpredictable Tera types make it a great user of Assault Vest.

  • Dazzling Gleam punishes Dark-type revenge killers such as Hydreigon and Meowscarada when combined with Tera.

  • Thunderbolt is Gholdengo's best shot at muscling past Dondozo and also deals good damage to Corviknight and Tera Flying Garganacl.

Tera Types

  • Water-type: With Assault Vest, Gholdengo can tank most Fire-type attacks against it and deal good damage to Volcarona. Watch out for its Giga Drain after Quiver Dance, though.

  • Flying-type: A Flying-type makes Gholdengo much more difficult to revenge kill with common Earthquake users such as Garchomp and Dragonite.

sets.name: Sheer Force
sets.description: Iron Valiant's great offensive stats and wide movepool make it a great Sheer Force wallbreaker. Its coverage is almost perfect: barring the use of abilities that provide an immunity to Iron Valiant's attacks, Corviknight, Skeledirge, Gholdengo, Iron Moth, and Clodsire are all at risk of being OHKOed or 2HKOed after minor chip damage. To more reliably defeat Ghost-types, Iron Valiant can even run Shadow Ball instead of Thunderbolt or Knock Off over Psychic-type coverage. A Naive nature is used to maximize the amount of targets Iron Valiant outspeeds, such as Iron Moth, Iron Treads, and Garchomp. Iron Valiant fits best on balance teams that appreciate its ability to pave the way for other dangerous attackers like Dragapult and Great Tusk. Iron Valiant appreciates allies that can keep the field clear of entry hazards, such as Corviknight and Avalugg, and also switch in on dangerous priority like Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Choice Specs Miraidon is a fierce wallbreaker that can reliably threaten nearly the entire tier with it's lethal offensive typing. Volt Switch helps maintain momentum and can scout opposing Terastallization. Trick ruins Ice Scales users like Goodra-H and Arceus-Grass lacking a held Plate, and Steam Eruption threatens burns and targets Ground-types like Ting-Lu and Clodsire; Grass Knot hits many of the same targets but makes Miraidon easier to Imposter-proof. Miraidon's massive damage potential and ability to break down defensive cores makes it an excellent fit on offense. Palkia-O and Final Gambit Eternatus make good partners, as they can help remove Ground-types and weaken special walls with Dragon Energy. Terastallizing into one of its original types is useful to supercharge Miraidon's damage output; however, Tera Steel can be useful to get a surprise KO on Zacian-C, and Tera Fairy is useful for blanking an Imposter user's Dragon Energy. Imposter-proofing is generally done with a specially defensive Ground-type teammate like Ting-Lu or Groudon.

sets.name: Set-up Sweeper
sets.description: Miraidon's typing and good stats make it a potent setup sweeper. Nasty Plot provides higher immediate power, whereas Quiver Dance makes setting up easier, enables the use of a Modest nature, and allows Miraidon to outspeed and threaten Zacian-C. Draco Plate + Judgment is used so Miraidon can fully self Imposter-proof, in addition to being usable at low HP, unlike Dragon Energy. Miraidon's best fit is on bulky teams that appreciate its instant damage output, potential to sweep, on top of its innate self-Imposter-proofing and good matchup into common Prankster users. Teammates that can help destroy Ice Scales users, such as Final Gambit Eternatus and Poison Heal Arceus-Fairy are appreciated, the latter of which can also absorb Knock Off. Miraidon should be careful when Terastallizing, as this removes its 4x Electric-type resistance and makes it more vulnerable to being PP stalled by Imposter; however, Tera Electric or Tera Dragon are useful for damage output, and Nasty Plot sets enjoy having Tera Steel for Zacian-C.
